Posts.Content: momof3nidaho wrote: When I had my mammogram everything turned out really good.  But I just got a call from my doctor today about the discharge from both of my breasts.  She wants me to come in to test my prolactin levels.  Does anyone know what she could be looking for? Posts.Title: Prolactin question momof3nidaho momof3nidaho

Posts.Content: momof3nidaho wrote: I had my very first mammogram today and the radiologist said everything looked great!  Ahhh, what a big relief.  She even said that because of my age (28) and the things she saw, she wouldn't even recommend future ones for a while.  I just want to say thank you to everyone on this sight.  You are all very strong and courageous women and I will continue to think about you and will put you in my prayers. Alicia Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Good news on my mammo! momof3nidaho momof3nidaho

Posts.Content: momof3nidaho wrote: Yesterday I went in for my yearly exam.  The doctor was doing her routine breast exam and we discovered a strange dark greyish-green nipple leakage.  She expressed some concern and insisted that I schedule a mammogram before I left the office.  I am a married mother of 3 young children and I am only 28.  I am pretty scared.  Now that I have read through some of the other postings, I suppose I should mention that I have had an ache in my armpit for a few weeks now.  The leakage is in the right breast and the ache is in the left armpit.  Maybe I'm just being paranoid Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Strange leakage, really concerned momof3nidaho momof3nidaho
